column4: Hi all. I have a number of web servers in a load balanced cluster. Can anyone suggest a way of replicating users' uploaded files (images) to all servers in the cluster?
You can use a clustered filesystem.  Or you could have them all mount a volume on a SAN or a fast NAS.
If you want solid and instantanious, you need to look at a SAN.  They cost $$, but they work.
The question will become, what's your budget, and how solid does it need to be?
If you're using all linux, you could use a coraid etherdrive SAN.  Those are pretty cheap, for a SAN.
If it helps, iscsi was rock solid when I used it on RHEL servers.
ikonia: is there an OSS solution? Would something like NFS work?
it would, given testing, and a reliable enough NFS server.  But an inexpsnive SAN is about the same price, and it's purpose built for it.
Are you at the point of zero budget or somefin? :)
I'd prefer to make use of what we've got if possible... shed loads of unused storage and RAID 6
did you have anything in mind when you suggested a clustered filesystem?

There are two types of cluster-filesystems.  Those which allow multiple servers to simultaniously use one physical drive.  And those where multiple servers all have their own physical drive, and but sync them togeather to look like one shared drive
The first type is more stable and better tested.
what would you recommended for the first option?
I honestly never got to use them, so I would just go with one that has active develoment.
GFS is supposed to be well spuported...and OCFS2 as well, but that's not under heavy development
